body_content.explanation: a round, wheel-shaped object on which sewing thread, fishing wire, film, etc. can be rolled, or the amount of thread, etc. stored on one of these
a fast Scottish or Irish dance, or the music for this
a short video posted on a social media website:
examples: How do you post a reel on Instagram?
Reels are intended for people who don't currently follow you.

body_content.explanation: to walk, moving from side to side, looking like you are going to fall:
examples: At closing time he reeled out of the bar and fell down on the pavement.
She hit him so hard that he reeled backwards.

body_content.explanation: If the place where you are reels, what you are looking at seems to go round and round in front of you:
examples: A stone hit his head and the street reeled before his eyes.

body_content.explanation: If you reel, or your mind or brain reels, you feel very confused or shocked and unable to act:
examples: We were reeling (in amazement/shock/delight, etc.) from/with the news that we had won all that money.
